channel.title: STA 210: Regression Analysis on STA 210
channel.description: Recent content in STA 210: Regression Analysis on STA 210

item.description: Note: This schedule may be updated as the semester progresses. Due dates for the exams and project will not be changed. Date Lesson Slides Reading Lab AE HW Project Week 01 Mon, Aug 26 Welcome to Regression Analysis Wed, Aug 28 Review: Statistical Inference Thu, Aug 29 Lab 01 Week 02 Mon, Sep 2 Review: Statistical Inference UNIT 1 CONTINUOUS RESPONSE VARIABLES Wed, Sep 4 Simple Linear Regression (SLR) Thu, Sep 5 Lab 02 Week 03 Mon, Sep 9 SLR: Inference & Prediction Wed, Sep 11 ANOVA, Part 1 Thu, Sep 12 Lab 03 Week 04 Mon, Sep 16 ANOVA, Part 2 Wed, Sep 18 Multiple Linear Regression (MLR) Thu, Sep 19 Lab 04 Week 05 Mon, Sep 23 MLR: Special Predictors Wed, Sep 25 MLR: Transformations Thu, Sep 26 Lab 05 Week 06 Mon, Sep 30 MLR: Model Selection Wed, Oct 2 MLR: Model Diagnostics Thu, Oct 3 Lab 06 Week 07 Mon, Oct 7 NO CLASS - Fall Break Wed, Oct 9 Recap & Review Thu, Oct 10 Exam 1 Review Week 08 Mon, Oct 14 Exam 1 Wed, Oct 16 MLR: Special Activity Thu, Oct 17 Lab 07 UNIT 2 CATEGORICAL RESPONSE VARIABLES Week 09 Mon, Oct 21 Comparing proportions & odds Wed, Oct 23 Logistic Regression, Part 1 Thu, Oct 24 Lab 08 Week 10 Mon, Oct 28 Logistic Regression, Part 2 Wed, Oct 30 Logistic Regression, Part 3 Thur, Oct 31 Lab 09 Week 11 Mon, Nov 4 Multinomial Logistic Regression, Part 1 Wed, Nov 6 Multinomial Logistic Regression, Part 2 Thu, Nov 7 Lab 10 Week 12 Mon, Nov 11 Multinomial Logistic Regression, Part 3 Wed, Nov 13 Log-linear Models, Part 1 Thu, Nov 14 Lab 11 Week 13 Mon, Nov 18 Log-linear Models, Part 2 Wed, Nov 20 Exam 2 Review Thu, Nov 21 Exam 2 Review Week 14 Mon, Nov 25 Exam 2 Wed, Nov 27 NO CLASS - Thanksgiving Break Thu, Nov 28 NO LAB - Thanksgiving Break UNIT 3 MODELING IN PRACTICE Week 15 Mon, Dec 2 Special Topic Wed, Dec 4 Special Topic Thu, Dec 5 Project Final Exam Period Wed, Dec 11, 9a - 12p Project presentations

item.title: Course Policies
item.description: | -----------|--------------------------------- Homework | 25% Labs | 15% Exam I | 20% Exam II | 20% Final Project | 15% Teamwork | 5% If you have a cumulative numerical average of 90 - 100, you are guaranteed at least an A-, 80 - 89 at least a B-, and 70 - 79 at least a C-. The exact ranges for letter grades will be determined after Exam II. ### Inclusion & Accessibility This course is designed to be welcoming and accessible to all students.
